The hivemind has definitely spoken on this one. I also get where your coming from.

Thanks for the video. Kinda confused, though, as to how it says anything relevant.
And many people watched their content and liked it enough to subscribe. Why would they decide this? I mean, wouldn't this just be seen as further enabling these criminal actions to occur? I surmise that most of the subscribers would say they did not condone the content within the videos. But yet, they watched anyways. And now that the tables have somewhat turned, another faction of people are getting off on seeing these people get what's coming to them. People are dumb.

It's drama. People are going apeshit as if they have their lives vested in it. I get it. It's wrong. What these assholes were doing should never be done to children. But these reactions that people are having are absurd. It's the same volatile reactions that people had when Chris Hanson was doing his thing.
What we should be talking about is how the fuck did this family get so fucking popular on YouTube in the first place.

That's not what I am saying at all. All I am saying is that people are becoming increasingly obsessed with stupid drama on youtube. This is not any different than what happens to all sorts of children every single day, but just because it's all of a sudden it's hyped on youtube, its now like some sort of new thing?
I mean come on. A shit ton of assholes made these morons popular on YouTube. That should be what is talked about. That is the problem. Idiots watching idiots breed idiots.
Now just because this shit is visible people are all up on their high horses.
Needs blood pudding
It's drama that is on youtube. And people are eating the crap up.

Just for fun, I wanted to check out the current line of succession to the presidency (taken from wiki):
~~~
"1 Vice President Mike Pence (R)
2 Speaker of the House of Representatives Paul Ryan (R)
3 President pro tempore of the Senate Orrin Hatch (R)
4 Secretary of State Rex Tillerson (R)
5 Secretary of the Treasury Steven Mnuchin (R)
6 Secretary of Defense James Mattis (I)
7 Attorney General Jeff Sessions (R)
8 Secretary of the Interior Ryan Zinke (R)
9 Secretary of Agriculture Sonny Perdue (R)
10 Secretary of Commerce Wilbur Ross (R)
11 Secretary of Labor Alex Acosta (R)
12 Secretary of Health and Human Services Tom Price (R)
13 Secretary of Housing and Urban Development Ben Carson (R)
Secretary of Transportation Elaine Chao (R)[a]
14 Secretary of Energy Rick Perry (R)
15 Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos (R)
16 Secretary of Veterans Affairs David Shulkin (I)
17 Secretary of Homeland Security John F. Kelly (I)
[a]^ Not a natural-born citizen (acquired U.S. citizenship by naturalization) and thus ineligible for the Presidency."
~~~
kinda scary..

Had a buddy tell me back in the day to always use a towel over the tip of the spine when cutting through larger chunks of cheese. The scar that he had on the palm of the hand is all I needed to see for it to be ingrained in the long list of how I do certain things in a kitchen.
And without a doubt, the best way to learn how to *not* cut yourself, is to cut yourself. Numerous times.
Definitely not something like this one though. This one is pretty fucked. That'd be stupid. Even if you could get it to stop bleeding, the heat from the line would make this practically unbearable.

Yeah, maybe. Guessing compatibility has definitely grown. Took me a while to be willing to give it a chance. I've been pretty impressed so far. It's really nice if you have stuff stored up on Drive (maybe other cloud services?) or an NAS.

Lol, yeah, older folks.. They can be so thick headed sometimes when it comes to learning this shit. My Mom (who's not even that old- 56) has *literally* never used an actual computer. Seriously..she just refuses. It can be pretty frustrating trying to show her tech stuff. Helps with my patience, though, I guess.
Maybe some apps are better than others? I can pause without any lag, right from my lockscreen. There is a lag when seeking though. Everything has their pros and cons and for me being able to use my phone as an all-in-one and eliminate all those stupid remotes is pretty sweet.
I just started using chromecast, and wasn't the one that set it up, so I didn't know this, actually. I use the local cast app and it doesn't have that option. Just downloaded the home app. Thanks
Nice to see someone who is actually from there, chiming in.

Seriously. The convenience and ease of navigation is what did it for me. It would be nice to be able to cast everything, though.
